meanings.definition: To make something commercial in character.
meanings.sent1: The small bakery commercialised their famous cookie recipe to sell to more customers.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to commercialise their new product by advertising it on TV.
meanings.sent3: The kids commercialised their lemonade stand by adding a fun mascot to attract more buyers.
meanings.sent4: She commercialised her hobby of painting by selling her artwork online.
meanings.sent5: The artist commercialised his unique style by opening a gallery in the city center.

meanings.sent1: Some companies commercialise the natural resources of developing countries for their own gain.
meanings.sent2: The unethical businessman tried to commercialise the situation for his personal benefit.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky salesman tried to commercialise the customer's confusion to make a quick sale.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist commercialised people's trust to deceive them into investing in fake schemes.
meanings.sent5: The greedy corporation commercialised the vulnerability of consumers to increase their profits.

meanings.sent1: The traditional family business decided to commercialise their products for online sales.
meanings.sent2: The local market vendors are looking to commercialise their goods for export.
meanings.sent3: The old bookstore commercialised their inventory by offering online ordering and delivery.
meanings.sent4: The farmer commercialised his crops by selling them at the new farmers' market.
meanings.sent5: The artisan commercialised her handmade crafts by setting up a booth at the craft fair.
